result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Riley Guntner

records.addlTxt:
Conditions:
Within 6 hours of release defendant to turn over to Police Department any drugs or drug paraphernalia items, turned over will not result in criminal charges. 
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Curfew 10pm to 6am.
6am-10pm - defendant must be at home, unless at work, school or court.
Defendant is allowed to attend meetings with his attorney, medical appointments, and routine errands with a parent.

Waives reading of the complaint. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. Bond set.
